text: Hi everyone. I have a Landing page with a custom module with a form. The form on the screenshot is just a representation, not the actual form. Once the person fills out the form it goes to the appropriate quotes service that then sends back the quote to a custom property. The issue I have is how do I have that custom quote appear once returned for that submission. How do I identify that user for the API response since it is just a public webpage. I feel like I’m missing something pretty simple. Appreciate any help thank you.
Can you associate it by the deal object?
… if you have the Form-Submit, you have the Contact ID, and then from there. I think it could work.

First, please note that I’m not great with APIs. So this is a public page and this person isn’t in the system until you push submit. So, no ID is generated yet, but I can capture the email using a webhook.

This webhook send the info to a company that has built the API to talk to the Quote service then return the info to the API service and updates our database. The problem is how do I then update the webpage for the person waiting for the quote to return?

Why dont you send them an Email with the Quote, then you have his data to reach out again - could even build out a little Customer Journey. If you display the Quote right away, he might not save it or something else.
I completely get that and it is the plan but the client wants to display it on the page.
I guess you could say “real-time”.
If you want, you can call me and explain what you have. It’s for sure duable as you seems to be on Enterprise.
They are actually on starter at the moment. I’m in my dev account, but any thoughts would be great. If you want to chat about it just DM me.
How about if you forward the form to a new page and the quote is there…
that embed js for the form can have some additonal code to to some stuff on submit

I’m really just looking for the correct route to take. Question if I use AJAX or JS from the module and there are multiple requests at the same time to the outside API point will or how does it know which page to deliver to.
I thought about a thank you page and then using a personalized token, but what if the response hasn’t been returned yet.

think there are options: <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/755885/how-do-i-make-jquery-wait-for-an-ajax-call-to-finish-before-it-returns>
<https://www.w3docs.com/snippets/javascript/waiting-until-all-jquery-ajax-requests-are-done.html>
Isn’t there a way to say send something identifying such as cookie, IP or something I could include in the JSON to the API that they could then verify which page is requesting which quote?
I can get the data into HubSpot database just not sure how to update the page.
do you mean hubdb?
i might have an idea…
No, I used Postman to push the change to the property to replicate the return API.
…if you create a unique token with the form, send that to the quote, and then store the quote in hubdb with that token… then wait until hubdb has that token available and then show it.
but there are probably better ways :slightly_smiling_face: thing is more - i dont really know your setting,
I will look into that. In HubSpot there a way to add a unique parameter in the URL each time the page is shown?
not that i know, but you could create with js a token, for instance the current timestamp and use that
Thanks for the ideas.
i hope it works
